item.title: Series 4 of 10 -- Fitting Linear Models - Multiple Regression
item.dc:creator: Hai Nguyen
item.description: Review a simple linear regression using Bayesian Methods How to fit a linear multiple regression (Stan) using Bayesian Methods Cases of significant/insignificant, correlated and collinear predictors Shrinkage Bayesian model with or without shrinkage, ridge regression and lasso regression: An example of SAT scores

item.title: Series 3 of 10 -- How to Compare Two Groups with Robust Bayesian Estimation
item.dc:creator: Hai Nguyen
item.description: 4 years ago, the argument about the stop relying 100% on null hypothesis significance testing (NHST) which was the P-VALUE. A very appealing alternative to NHST is Bayesian statistics, which in itself contains many approaches to statistical inference. In this post, I provide an introductory and practical tutorial to Bayesian parameter estimation in the context of comparing two independent groups' data based on the adaption of UC's lecture and Kruschke's textbook (Chapter 16).

item.title: Series 2 of 10 -- MCMC for Estimation of Gaussian parameters
item.dc:creator: Hai Nguyen
item.description: Run MCMC on binomial model Gaussian distribution, one sample Hierarchical model, two groups of Gaussian observations

item.description: Fitting an unconditional model (without predictors) Robust estimates -- Gaussian vs. t-distribution
